column11: Review Text

column8: Lanka forex money exchange at Crescat boulevard are scammers, beware!
column11: Went to Crescat for shopping, good variety of shops. But, beware of the money exchange called Lanka forex pvt ltd. on second floor, they are scammers, they didn't give us the right amount, Rs 22,000 less when we counted, back in our hotel. When we complained. They panicked, and said it must be a fault in their counting machine, after we insisted on cctv footage. They said they will put the rest of money they owed, into our account and took details as we were going on tour next day. Never gave us the money, despite promising. Stopped answering our calls. Avoid this place.

column8: Excellent Vegetarian biriyani at Crescat Boulevard
column11: The Biriyani  place in the corner of the food court at Crescat deserves 5 stars for friendly service, enthusiasm, care and superb taste.  Staff there were always so engaging when hunting for a dinner option and happy to help. Portions greats. Nice tea too.  Vegetarian food was no issue to them. Paneer biriyani was excellent. We came back for more the next day. The other food outlets in the food court were unenthusiastic staff with no patience to discuss vegetarian options.

column8: An average mall in Sri Lanka
column11: My wife and I go to the Crescat Boulevard Mall around every six weeks for a hair appointment at Chagall and to do some shopping in the mall, especially as there is a very good wine shop in the mall.

When I first started visiting this mall, it was much more interesting and there were many more shops that I used regularly, one shoe shop in particular.  Sadly, over time, this mall has become smaller and smaller and the attraction of shopping there has faded.  There are some interesting outlets, but not as many as before.  It is now only average.

If your hotel is close by and you’re looking for a supermarket, there’s a great Keell’s on the lower ground floor. The rest of the mall is pretty neat with some nice stores including a small branch of Luv SL. One of the better malls in the area and not crammed full of high-end branded stores selling stuff you can’t possibly afford.

We visited the Swarovski store in this mall to check if they had a necklace to match a bracelet I had bought there. There are ladies and menswear shops there and in the basement us a food court.  It's cheap and cheerful so don't expect anything fantastic but if you are on a budget it's perfect. Asian food, fried chicken, juice stalls and an ice cream still are on offer. There are public toilets also.

I couldn’t find dunstan’s own page so I’m having to give them a review on here. This is by far the best barbars that I have ever been to in my whole entire life! Wow just wow. Amazing customer service, friendly professional staff who for once know not only what they are talking about but also know how to there job. I had a haircut and a shave and I thought Turkish barbars gave an amazing haircut and a shave but the guy who did both of mine was absolutely an amazement. Highly recommend and will be visiting again!

column8: Added bonus if you are staying an Cinnamon Grand
column11: The Mall is entered for the side of Cinnamon Grand and has a Keels supermarket, ATM and a food court.  We ate at Shanmuga's vegetarian restaurant - clean, quick and cheap and really good masala dosa. Great way to avoid getting all hot and sweaty searching for dinner when you have a late flight!

column8: Still high quality, thanks to Cinnamon Grand
column11: This mall still attracts lots of people, probably mainly tourists thanks to the Cinnamon Grand hotel next door. But this is a lovely little mall, where you can find among others Hameedia, for nice shirts and suits, also some tea shops, as well as a small department store of Odel and of course, not to forget, the food court downstairs, where especially the Sri Lankan Hub is worth trying out! Real original ceylon food prepared in clay pots. Unfortunately, also here, you can notice the amount of closed shops, due to relocation elsewhere in newer malls. Definitely worth a visit.

This is my favourite place in colombo and i  often visit here. Starting from entrance the place was very neat and the place has modern facilities. Eassy to access every shops and the food court is high in hygiene.My favourite is Thai Express .They have variety of foods and lots of choices .In the basement there is a market called John Keels and the people who were working all  very friendly and they treat the customer in good way .Last Sunday I visit there and I bought  some gift items and i need a rapping papers with box to cover that . Mr.premachandra the manager on duty he assist with me to find the stuffs and there  is a one guy I couldn't catch his name he also very helpful.Specialy I would like to thanks Mr.premachandra he is always greeting the customers with smile and very polite person.Best place to visit .
A nice place with a small food court. Food selection small but good for a quick bite. Clean place and nicely done. Ambience is nice too. Can visit.

There is a good supermarket in the basement, a very good nail salon and other jewellery, books and souvenir shops. The linen shop is a find - on the ground floor. I’ve been there on four trips to Colombo and always get great value tunics, blouses and dresses.

I ordered a PadThai chicken noodles from this place and it was terrible.. I couldn’t eat even 3-4 spoons I felt it was not right! The taste was horrendous and nothing seems to be right with it. Chicken didn’t taste like chicken at all! Something was wrong with the food plate! I even got a bad tummy after I came home. The standard and the cleanliness of the food court has really dropped. There were flies all over and the cleaning staff just wiped off the tables without using any detergent.

This used to be such a buzzing boulevard where you were spoilt for choice.  It is not very pricey and many of the stores have now closed.  There are the usual outlets - but not as many as I would have liked.  I struggled to find a decent shoe shop!

Came to this great place several times whilst in Colombo. The food hall has a great range of food represented from various countries.The best, of course, is the local food. That is what they are best at. Opposite the food hall is a well stocked clean supermarket.(great range of  spices to take home or a few snacks,fresh fruit to your hotel. We walked from to it from our hotel near the Old Hospital. Returned by tuk-Tuks back Rs300 set fare.Unfair and petty for us to barter over $ Aus 2.25.
I visited crescat Boulevard I visited with my school friends we had pizza in the food court and celebrated our friends birthday I recommend this place for everyone

Found this place pricey. Expensive shops on ground and lower ground floor. Go to basement for a full dining experience with a range of take away cuisines. Toilets were also on this level and were spotless.

I fully endorse what Ron342 from the Netherlands said about the TukTuk drivers ripping off tourists outside Crescat. This is nothing more than economic racism. A trip one way is Rs64/-. The exact same trip in reverse using a TukTuk from outside Crescat is Rs300. If you are white they think you’re a tourist even if you live here. Please note that these drivers have nothing whatsoever to do with Crescat. They are totally independent. Under no circumstances should you use them. From July 1st all Tuk Tuks have to have a meter that dispenses a printed receipt so things might get better.
You can choose from a big variation of local food at reasonable prices. The food is safe to eat also for expat. Grocery shopping is ok here too.
When you can't get some expensive item in fashion , chances are you will find it here. Have a reasonable food court. But the prices would be above average.

This mall covers 3 floors with the ground floor offering a food court area with varied options & a supermarket. The shop selection is ok, mainly shoe shops with a selection of clothes, stationary, sports shops, tea specialists & jewellers. There is however a nice restaurant near the entrance & door staff are friendly & welcoming. We took a tuk tuk here from the train station. Worth a visit if you want to escape the heat but you’d need no more than an hour for a visit. I purchased a lovely  cashmere pashmina here & got it for half the price after bartering. Most shops however are set prices.

A convenient and nearby mall adjacent to Cinnamon Grand hotel with everything under one roof. Food court and supermarket at lower ground floor serves a variety of food,  groceries and wellness that cater to everyone's needs. A stall selling home-grown cashew nuts is a big hit. A variety of flavoured cashew nuts that can suit your taste buds.

This place is OK very clean with good air con with some nice dining options, as for shopping not to much to choose from and the few things I did like it was not possible in my size (I am fairly average) It looked liked some extensions are underway so maybe some additions will add to the appeal.

The Crescat Boulevard Mall served us very well in our last day in Colombo. After our breakfast we took a tuk-tuk to this mall, initially to bring my wife to a Triumph shop (international brand for bra). Indeed she was very pleased, since she succeeded to find some to buy to a good price (half from home...). Also our stroll between shops allowed us to find many presents and still not to be out (it was hot outside). Even in the supermarket (located in the basement) we were able to find some things for our grandsons. In order to rest we went to Grand Cinnamon Hotel (there is a passage to connect it), where we enjoyed coffee, shake, small pastries, small chocolates (all of them of the best quality and very cheap). It was very nice there since it was well air-conditioned, piano in the background and a lot of different people crossing.

We returned to Crescat after a year away and were able to obtain all of our basic requirements under one roof in this mall. It is a clean, pleasant shopping mall with a large supermarket in the basement that sells pretty well everything you would be looking for in a supermarket - including a pharmacy and alcohol. On the other floors you will find stores selling clothing and sports goods, an excellent stationers, a book shop, mobile phone store, chocolates, tea, gifts and so on. You will also find toilets and ATMs. Overall it is a good experience and generally goods purchased are of good quality.

This is the smallest of the modern shopping malls in Colombo, and apart from a few jewelry and clothing stores the only real interest is in the food court in the basement. It is certainly not worth making the trip out specifically to visit it. We spent less than 15 minutes there, as there really was nothing to see.

Sri Lankan Claypot O Curry, situated at the Crescat Mall in Colombo has a large clientele of repeat customers. There is a good reason for it. It serves very tasty meals at budget prices with much courtesy. The cuisine is Southern Sri Lankan. As is common to Malls all over the world, the eateries especially the popular ones can be very crowded at peak lunch and dinner times. Crescat Mall is no exception. Claypot can really get crowded at lunch time since it is the most popular restaurant at the Mall. And the only one that serves Sri Lankan food. The others serve Indian, Thai, Malaysian, Chinese and Mongolian food. So Claypot has its regular clientele from the office workers, shoppers and tourists at lunch time. If you want to avoid the huge line-up at lunch time, go there just before 12 noon. In the evenings it is not so crowded as the office workers and tired shoppers go home for dinner and so it is mostly those out for an evening  with their families who will go there for a bite of something. The food is very tasty. You could get white or brown rice with four curries, fish or chicken for Rs.400 ($2.63). If you choose to pay by credit card, you get a 10% discount at Rs. 360 ($2.37). These prices are lower than one would pay as tips for a budget lunch in some of the cheap eateries in New York. A lunch at Claypot would cost about $15.00 at a cheap eatery in New York. Service charge and tips would be extra. In the evenings, in addition to rice and curry, this outlet has other Sri Lankan favorites such as kottu roti, stringhoppers, pittu and gothamba roti, all at reasonable prices. There is also the lamprais packets, made famous in Sri Lanka by the Dutch. I am always amazed by the courtesy shown by the employees to all the customers. Most of the employees wear a “permanent” smile and are always patient and helpful to the customers. I wonder how they are able to do it when they have hundreds of customers to serve. It is difficult to recommend anything as outstanding since all their dishes are excellent. Yet their seafood dishes have a slight edge over other dishes, especially the fish and sprats (small fish) curries. A typical meal at Claypot will cost only half as much as in Urban Kitchen in Colombo where the meals are priced according to weight. Urban Kitchen is also a favorite Sri Lankan restaurant of mine. The advantage of Urban Kitchen is that  you can eat in peace and not besieged by crowds as at a Food Court in a Mall. Bon Apetit 349richardsc New York

Crescat Bouleverd mall is centrally located and just beside the Cinnamon Grand Hotel, a good place for shopping, where almost every essential things are available. It has Brand shops, which are a bit expensive. Some good book shops, handicrafts and souvenir shops are also available. The mall has a supermarket named Keels and a food court at the basement. There is a bunch of good restaurants with varieties of choices of food are available at the food court. We stayed at Cinnamon Grand Hotel, therefore, it was very convenient for us to go there frequently. This is a great place for shopping and dining. There is a money changer available at the mall, which provides good exchange rate.

An upscale shopping mall next to the Cinnamon Grand Hotel. There is a John Keells supermarket in the basement which has a good range of produce, particularly if you are a tourists wishing to self cater. The meat and fish selection is usually better than supermarkets in more popular locations. There is a branch of Colombo Jewellery Stores (the best jewellery store in Colombo) and Roots (for fresh juice/smoothies), The tuk tuk's (3 wheeler taxi's) outside are a disgrace and don't put their meters on. They prefer to barter and overcharge with someone directing operations. It is high time the management of this shopping mall sorts this long standing problem out as it is a huge turn off particularly for visitors. If you walk away from the mall onto the busy main road you will easily hail an "honest" driver.

Me and my mom enjoyed our time in this mall but the prices are too high so,it's not a place for shopping but you will enjoy your time while buying chocolate and eating at the basement, they have nice restaurants .

Small shopping mall at Galle face. A few branded shops and also souvenir shops. A large supermarket and a food court with choices of food at the basement are the best option here. Nice place to take a break from hot air outside:).
There were few good shops to do shopping, parking is available, that is the best thing. They have a good food court, this place is better for dine than doing shopping.

they say this is a high end mall, but except for a few premium watch shops and puma and adidas , there is nothing much high end to it and it is very small mall, average time to complete the mall will be 20-30 minutes thier food court is large hoever food is not upto the mark thier my say is visit if you want to explore the city, they have a high end BISTRO at the ground level, which you want to visit

This mall is just 2 floors with some international brands and some upmarket sri lankan brands. We did not spend much time here as there was nothing much to see. I would suggest the libert plaza or majestic city for a better shopping experience.
Lots of shops and restaurants attached to Cinnamon Grand Hotel. My favorite was the food court with every kind of food at great prices!

My second visit to Foot Rub and I will certainly go again when the opportunity arises. All the staff are excellent at their job and gave a very thorough massage and pedicure. A relaxing treat at the end of a hectic 3 weeks and thoroughly recommended.

Situated next door to the Cinnamon Grand Hotel, this is a nice little mall.  There are a good cross section of stores:- Stationery store Menswear Ladies wear Bags Spa Ceylon Massage Hair Salon Beauty Salon Jewellary stores Swarovski store - you can bargain in here Souvenir store And many more Underground there is a cheap food court but remember, you get what you pay for - it's cheap and cheerful self service. There is a small supermarket with a reasonable selection of foodstuffs. Trishaws are queued put at the front and back of this building.

Crescat Boulevard is a three floor, modestly-sized shopping centre along the busy Galle Road. It stocks a wide range of products, from shoes and clothes to stationary and books, accessories, watches, handicrafts, dresses saree boutiques and many more on list. Basement has food court and supermarket. This mall is connected to Cinnamon grand hotel.

Crescat is always our local shopping area when we are staying in the locality. In the basement there is a large well-stocked supermarket where one can purchase most things. It has a great range of vegetables, groceries, spices and stationery. On the floors above you will find a good though somewhat chaotically organised bookstore, clothing shops, sports goods outlets, a shoe shop, hairdressers, an excellent stationers, phone store and more besides. Generally one can get all requirements in the Mall. It is clean and pleasant and adjacent to the Cinnamon Grand Hotel on the Galle Road.
Its an ok mall. There is shops some of them are of reasonable prices others are expensive with no reason. There is also a food court and a supermarket.

After you visit Crescat shopping mall or Cinnamon Grand Hotel beware of tuktuk drivers in white shirts waiting for you on Galle Road. They are closely monitoring you and watching your every move. Than when you look in their direction they start waving and calling you for a tuk tuk ride. Do not get in their tuktuk, they have false meters as well, normally it's 50 Rps per km, if you watch their meter it's changing every 100 meters to 50 Rps. Ignore them completely and pretend you don't see or hear them at all. I used to pretend being on my phone, worked well.

This mall is quite comfortable. there is a Keels supermarket. It is not too far from Fort so you can take a cheap tuktuk there probably around 150-250LKR. There is a nice stall that sells huge cashew nuts right outside the supermarket. Also since it is attached to Cinnamon hotel, I went to the hotel cafe for a cup of coffee.

Had our lunch today at the food court. Tried today sri lankan foods stall..lump rice and set menu..we odered our foods its about 12.30 pm..but all curries not cooked untill that time.we would like to suggest you to prepare lunch on time. At least 12 noon..Tasty foods and staff..we enjoyed..

An upscale shopping mall next to the Cinnamon Grand Hotel. There is a John Keells supermarket in the basement which has a good range of produce, particularly if you are a tourists wishing to self cater. The meat and fish selection is usually better than supermarkets in more popular locations. There is a branch of Colombo Jewellery Stores (the best jewellery store in Colombo), Roots (for fresh juice/smoothies), Vijitha Yapa bookshop and a food court.
Best mall in Colombo...upscale and next to the Cinnamon Grand...a great hotel and resort.  Many shops to experience
nice place for shopping where you can find branded stuff, a bit expensive i must say. but a must visit place.

It has many local brands and some international brands like reebok and nike. There is Keels and a food court in the basement. Several clothing stores, jewellery and spa ceylon too. Nothing that impressive!
You can hangout there in a very decent manner and do some decent  shopping! It has nice interior looking and you can feel relax inside.
Good location in prime area. Food court (with asia and local food) at basement. Supermarket, bank, speciality shops such as Dilmah Tea etc.

Every thing in one place, best place to shopping in Colombo with out hassle everything in one place ! This place good for tourists and local too. All kind of luxury items too can purchase here, also nice restaurant here on Ground floor Sugar , thier is another cafe call coco , don't bother to go thier service very poor , quality of food is very poor and all are pricy and worthlessness for any single rupees! I can't believe that cafe still running business!

Unlike other malls, this one is sober to have decent attendance and not over crowded like others. Has shops in most of the categories and you can also pick up souvenirs from here. Situated next to Cinnamon Grand, there is a direct connectivity also.

I like this place very much. I used to visit every Sunday or more often if I'm free with my friends. It's not very crowded so you can actually have good time. The food court too offers good food for reasonable prices and liquor available till 2 pm in the food or there's a pub too. Great for shopping and there's salons and a nail spa if I remember.

our tour operator told us that this is a small shopping place but the items offered are with high quality. At the basement there is a supermarket then you can find a food court with different international cuisines. i advise you to visit a store "Odel" it is a modern wear store for teen agers and this store has many branches in Sri Lanka.
